content: I wish it were the GAO, but that's another matter. content: The GAO is an arm of the US Congress to oversee and audit questionable programs, agencies of the federal government. Numbers, statistics, etc. can be collected and depicted in a myriad of ways and then interpreted to suit the person or organization by inserting the "what-if's" that are considered. My understanding is the GAO is straight lining the information it collected and the Administration is disagreeing by predicting the economy will revive earlier than the GAO prediction so more tax dollars will come into the US Treasury to off set the deficits.
